intro: Piper baracoanum, commonly known as the Bornean pepper vine, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper species. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in greenish-yellow clusters. Its fruits are initially green and turn red when mature, resembling tiny peppers. The plant is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
